title: American_Top_40_1977_May_14th
description:
THIS FILE WAS PREVIOUSLY TORRENTED AS "American_Top_40_May_14th,_1977" IF YOU DOWNLOADED THAT FILE YOU ALREADY HAVE THIS ONE. THIS IS THE NEW TORRENT OF THAT SAME FILE AND THAT TORRENT WILL NO LONGER BE SEEDED. THIS IS ONE OF THE FIRST 15 I EVER TORRENTED. I'M JUST CHANGING THE NAME SO ALL SHOW TITTLES ARE FORMATTTED ALIKE.

American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This rebroadcast is one of many I have recorded from internet radio. Some are incomplete but most are not and I hope you enjoy these as much as I do.
In this broadcast:

Jimmy Buffett has a new song called "Margaritaville."

Undercover Angel is the fastest mover on the chart, on its way for a one week stay at number one.

Casey answers the question, "Which hit by an American group made it quickest to number one?" It's a good story.

Sorry for the lame extra. I've got people looking into it.

Casey explains what only Sylvester Stallone has in common with Charlie Chaplin and Orson Wells.

Kenny Rogers is on the chart with his first solo hit.
